Detailed Description

pruicss driver interface

============================================================================

The pruss header file should be included in an application as follows:

#include <ti/drv/pruss/pruss.h>

Macro Definition Documentation

#define PRUICSS_MDIO   (10U)

Invalid Intc Mux number, intc Mux not used if assigned PRUSS_INVALID_INTC_MUX_NUM

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct PRUICSS_IntrCfg_s PRUICSS_IntrCfg

PRUICSS interrupt config structure.

Default interrrupt configuration parametetrs

int32_t PRUICSS_pruInitMemory ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  pruMem 
)

This function initializes the PRU memory to zero.

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruMemPRU Memory Macro

pruMem can have the following values PRU_ICSS_SHARED_RAM
PRU_ICSS_DATARAM(n) where n is the PRU number
PRU_ICSS_IRAM(n) where n = 0 for PRU0,n = 1 for PRU1, n = 2 for RTU0, n = 3 for RTU1, maintaing this for backward compabitility , should use macros below
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_PRU(n) where n = 0 for PRU0,n = 1 for PRU1
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_RTU(n) where n = 0 for RTU0,n = 1 for RTU1
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_TXPRU(n) where n = 0 for TXPRU0,n = 1 for TXPRU1

Returns
word length written or 0 on error.

This function initializes the PRU memory to zero.

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruMemPRU Memory Macro

pruMem can have the following values PRU_ICSS_SHARED_RAM
PRU_ICSS_DATARAM(n) where n is the PRU number
PRU_ICSS_IRAM(n) where n = 0 for PRU0,n = 1 for PRU1, n = 2 for RTU0, n = 3 for RTU1, maintaing this for backward compabitility , should use macros below
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_PRU(n) where n = 0 for PRU0,n = 1 for PRU1
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_RTU(n) where n = 0 for RTU0,n = 1 for RTU1
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_TXPRU(n) where n = 0 for TXPRU0,n = 1 for TXPRU1

Returns
word length written or 0 on error.

int32_t PRUICSS_pruReadMemory ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  pruMem,
uint32_t  wordoffset,
uint32_t *  dest_mem,
uint32_t  bytelength 
)

This function reads from PRU memory and stores in block of memory.

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruMemPRU Memory Macro
wordoffsetOffset at which the read will happen.
dest_memDestination memory[ Array of uint32_tegers ]
bytelengthTotal number of bytes to be read

pruMem can have the following values PRU_ICSS_SHARED_RAM
PRU_ICSS_DATARAM(n) where n is the PRU number
PRU_ICSS_IRAM(n) where n = 0 for PRU0,n = 1 for PRU1, n = 2 for RTU0, n = 3 for RTU1, maintaing this for backward compabitility , should use macros below
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_PRU(n) where n = 0 for PRU0,n = 1 for PRU1
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_RTU(n) where n = 0 for RTU0,n = 1 for RTU1
PRU_ICSS_IRAM_TXPRU(n) where n = 0 for TXPRU0,n = 1 for TXPRU1

Returns
word length read or 0 on error.

int32_t PRUICSS_registerIrqHandler ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  pruEvtoutNum,
int32_t  intrNum,
int32_t  eventNum,
uint8_t  waitEnable,
PRUICSSDRV_IRQ_HANDLER  irqHandler 
)

This function Registers an Interrupt Handler for an event.
.

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruEvtoutNumThe ARM side event number.
intrNumInterrupt number of MPU/C66x
eventNumEvent number of PRUICSS
waitEnableFlag specifying whether application can wait on this interrupt using PRUICSSPruWaitEvent function
irqHandlerPointer to a function which will be called on interrupt.
Returns
0 in case of successful registration, -1 otherwise.
Parameters
pruEvtoutNumThe ARM side event number.
handlePruss's driver handle
intrNumInterrupt number of MPU/C66x
eventNumEvent number of PRUICSS
waitEnableFlag specifying whether application can wait on this interrupt using PRUICSSPruWaitEvent function
irqHandlerPointer to a function which will be called on interrupt.
Returns
0 in case of successful registration, -1 otherwise.

int32_t PRUICSS_setConstantTblEntry ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  pruNum,
int32_t  constantTblEntry,
uint32_t  constantTblVal 
)

This API updates the constant table for specified constant table entry which have write permissions.

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruNumPRU number[0 or 1] for which constant table is being updated.
constantTblEntrycontant table entry being updated
constantTblValcontant table value to be written
Returns
0 success, -1 on error
int32_t PRUICSS_setGpMuxSel ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  pruNum,
uint32_t  mode 
)

This API configures the General Purpose Mux Selector field of the General Purpose Config Register (PRUSS_GPCFG)

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruNumPRU number[0 or 1].
modePRU-ICSS wrap mux selection
Returns
0 success, -1 on error
int32_t PRUICSS_setIepClkSrc ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  source 
)

This API configures the source of the IEP clock to be either IEP CLK as the source or Interface Bus CLK as the source (such as OCP/ICLK/VCLK) This is accomplished by updating the IEP clock field of the General Purpose Config Register (PRUSS_GPCFG)

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
sourcesource of the IEP clock (0 == IEP CLK, 1 == OCP/ICLK/VCLK)
Returns
0 success, -1 on error
int32_t PRUICSS_setPRUBuffer ( PRUICSS_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  pruNum,
void *  buffer,
uint32_t  numBytes 
)

This function sets the buffer pointer for PRU. The contents of this buffer will be
loaded to IRAM.
.

Parameters
handlePruss's driver handle
pruNumThe PRU number.
bufferPointer to buffer.
numBytesNumber of bytes in the buffer.
Returns
0 in case of successful transition, -1 otherwise.
